stories.title: Groundbreaking work on slave economy finally back on UK shelves

stories.text:
This got some interesting replies in a previous discussion about microservices, so let me bump it up to everybody: Where you work, what's the ratio between developers and services/deployable units? How does that ratio feel to you, and why?

That previous discussion: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=30079239
stories.title: Ask HN: What's your team's service-to-developer ratio?

stories.text:
The internet is filled with terrible and shallow articles about how a company should go about building internal development (and product) infrastructure, most of which either have the objective to shill particular paid (and lock-in) solutions or aim at putting a variety of SEO buzzwords in the hope of getting ad revenues.

So, dear HN, how should a startup go about developing their own (cloud-based) internal stack in 2022?

What is the state of the art of setting up secure, zero-trust, infrastructure that employees can use to quickly spin up services and tooling for internal use?

How is this done in your company? Are you happy with it?
stories.title: Ask HN: What is a solid infrastructure stack for internal apps in 2022?
